afester.javafx.components

Class MultiSegmentPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • afester.javafx.components.MultiSegmentPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable

    public class MultiSegmentPanel
extends javafx.scene.control.Control
    A multi segment display panel which is capable of displaying numbers and text, depending on the actual multi segment display type.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MultiSegmentPanel

        public MultiSegmentPanel(String segmentType,
                         int numberOfDigits)
        Creates a new seven segment display panel. Initially, all segments of the display are turned off. Then, the display contents can be set with the setText() and setValue() methods.
        Parameters:
        numberOfDigits - The number of digits for the panel.

      • MultiSegmentPanel

        public MultiSegmentPanel(String segmentType,
                         int numberOfDigits,
                         int decimalCount)
        Creates a new seven segment display panel. Initially, all segments of the display are turned off. Then, the display contents can be set with the setText() and setValue() methods.
        Parameters:
        numberOfDigits - The overall number of digits
        decimalCount - The number of decimal places

      • setValue

        public void setValue(double value)
        Sets a floating point number to display in the display panel. The number is auto-formatted to fit the setup of the display regarding the number of digits and the number of decimal places.
        Parameters:
        value - The floating point number to display.
